stackable

Class Attack

  • java.lang.Object
    • stackable.Attack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stackable

    public class Attack
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stackable
    Stackable - Attack
    Store one of the valid types of attacks supported by the game, encapsulating them in a stackable.
    Author:
    Karina Awoki, Renato Cordeiro Ferreira

    • Constructor Detail

      • Attack

        public Attack(java.lang.String attack)
       throws InvalidOperationException
        Default constructor.
        If the attack is not supported, throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        attack - String with the attack type (must be a supported type of attack).
        Throws:
        InvalidOperationException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Stackable
        General function to print, in a more legible format, the stackable. It is used mainly with debug purposes.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Stackable
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representing the stackable.
